intro: Calycophyllum venezuelense, commonly known as the Venezuelan calycophyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Calycanthaceae, which is characterized by its aromatic foliage and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests at higher elevations. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with prominent tubular corollas and numerous stamens. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
